I submit a humble “mea culpa.”

—Jenn (your CMI social-media manager)

Urban Adventure Squad
January 2 at 1:56 PM ·

Emily Rice of the DC Department of Energy & Environment (DOEE) joined the Squad today as we searched for the first hidden geocache in our new series.

Our project, “Geocaching DC’s Waterways,” involves hiding 5-6 geocaches with partner schools and school communities. Each geocache will highlight an aspect of stormwater runoff, its effects on the pollution of the Anacostia River, and how to mitigate it.

This geocache, which was hidden by another Squad just before Thanksgiving, highlights the trash trap at 14th and Gallatin Sts, NE, which traps litter before it lands in a tributary of the Anacostia River.

Emily Rice of the DC Department of Energy & Environment (DOEE) joined the Squad today as we searched for the first hidden geocache in our new series.

Our project, “Geocaching DC’s Waterways,” involves hiding 5-6 geocaches with partner schools and school communities. Each geocache will highlight an aspect of stormwater runoff, its effects on the pollution of the Anacostia River, and how to mitigate it.

This geocache, which was hidden by another Squad just before Thanksgiving, highlights the trash trap at 14th and Gallatin Sts, NE, which traps litter before it lands in a tributary of the Anacostia River.

Urban Adventure Squad
October 25, 2019 at 2:12 PM ·

Plants have evolved to give off a scent that attracts certain creatures and repels others. Human cultures recognized this and have found various uses for plant-based oils over thousands of years, using essential oils for ceremonies, to influence mood, medicinally, in cooking, and for cosmetics.

At Creative Minds International Public Charter School yesterday, middle school students spent their Genius Hour in the garden, making their own essential oil sprays with sweet orange, eucalyptus, peppermint, lavender, lemongrass, rosemary, & more!
